Adam Fisk wrote:
> Thanks Gordon-
> 
> I think I must still be missing something, though.  I'm currently
> using the SURT:
> 
> http://(com,example,www,)/
> 
> This appears in my SURT dump and debug statements.  I have a custom
> processor, however, and it's getting CURIs for things like:
> 
> http://grx.com
> 
> I'm getting things like that from curi.getUURI().getHost() as well as
> from curi.toString().  
> 
> I thought for a second this was because I was using the default list
> of decide rules from the user manual and the example, as shown below,
> but I removed both acceptIfTranscluded and acceptIfPrerequisite, and
> am still getting the above URI crawled.  Am I completely missing
> something?  How is it possible for me to see the above URI at the
> processing stage?

It could be transcluded (if it were referred to by certain short chains
of hops from other URLs already in-scope), but removing the
acceptIfTranscluded rule would eliminate that possibility.

If 'http://grx.com' appears in the crawl.log, you can deduce the
immediate predecessor URL, and hop-types that reached it, by the
respective fields right after the URL in that log.

If it doesn't appear in the crawl.log, are you perhaps reading it
out of the discovered links of another URL, rather than seeing
it be crawled itself?

- Gordon @ IA
